article.headline: Hereâs everything coming to HBO Max in July 2020, and whatâs leaving
article.body: HBO Max is only a month old, but itâs already become a go-to-destination for streaming classic movies, and will bolster its already impressive catalog in July 2020. Alongside a handful of original series â such as the three-part Amy Schumer docuseries âExpecting Amyâ (July 9) and the surreal animated comedy âClose Enoughâ (July 9) â the AT&T T, -1.01% Â -owned streaming service will add a ton of movies, including âThe Exorcist,â âAmerican Graffiti,â âBlazing Saddles,â âThe Departedâ and âThe Right Stuffâ (all July 1). div.youtube { height:0; position:relative; padding-bottom:56.25%; } div.youtube > iframe { position: absolute; left: 0; top: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; } Update: âThe House of Ho,â originally scheduled to debut in July, has been pushed back to the second half of the year, according to HBO Now. Thatâs on top of HBO originals such as Season 4 of the quirky anthology series âRoom 104â (July 23) and HBO Europeâs âFoodie Loveâ (July 13). Read more: Whatâs streaming in July on Netflix | Amazon Prime | Hulu | Disney+ Itâll also be your last chance to watch âCrazy Rich Asians,â "Blindspottingâ and âCasino Royale,â which are among the movies leaving in July.Whatâs coming in July 2020 July 1 Absolute Power, 1997 The Adventures of Pinocchio, 1996 The Amazing Panda Adventure, 1995 American Graffiti, 1973 (HBO) American History X, 1998 Angels in the Outfield, 1951 Angus, 1995 August Rush, 2007 The Bachelor, 1999 Batman & Mr. Freeze: SubZero, 1998 Batman and Harley Quinn , 2017 Batman vs. Two-Face, 2017 The Batman vs. Dracula, 2005 Batman: Assault on Arkham, 2014 Batman: Return of the Caped Crusaders, 2016 Batman: Under the Red Hood, 2010 Batman: Year One, 2011 Beautiful Creatures, 2013 Beerfest, 2006 The Big Year (Extended Version), 2011 (HBO) The Bishopâs Wife, 1947 Blade 2, 2002 Blade, 1998 Blade: Trinity, 2004 Blazing Saddles, 1974 div.youtube { height:0;
